Posts.Content: navysurfacespouse wrote: This is my first post on the forum.  I'm 39 (will be 40 next week) had a core biopsy today for an ~1.0cm palpable mass right near the nipple that I noticed on a self-exam.  I had a mammogram and ultrasound two days ago, and then the biopsy today.  There's no history of breast cancer in my family, and the radiologist said he thinks it looks like it could be a fibroadenoma (it was moving around when they were doing the biopsy).  I'm trying to stay positve, but I'm freaking out a bit knowing that I have to wait a week for the results.  And to top it off my husband, who's a naval officer, is currently deployed off the coast of Haiti.  Thankfully I was able to talk to him last night, which really helped, but I really wish he was here! Thanks for reading ... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: biopsy today and anxious navysurfacespouse Mouse6
